Class Toolbar

    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RichTextToolbar

    public class Toolbar
extends com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.FlowPanel
implements ButtonContainer, com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.HasAllFocusHandlers, com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.FocusHandler, com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.KeyUpHandler
    This is a Widget representing a toolbar. It renders a horizontal bar that is supposed to contain buttons with icons. You can directly add buttons. To put buttons into a ButtonGroup you may also use startGroup() and endGroup().
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

      • startGroup

        public void startGroup()
                throws IllegalStateException
        This method starts a new button-group and adds it to this container. All buttons (or widgets) added to this container until the button-group was ended will be added to the current button-group. A button-group is realized by ButtonGroup.
        Specified by:
        startGroup in interface ButtonContainer
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the previous button-group has NOT been ended.
        See Also:
        ButtonContainer.endGroup()

      • endGroup

        public boolean endGroup()
        This method ends a previously started group.
        Specified by:
        endGroup in interface ButtonContainer
        Returns:
        true if the current button-group has successfully been ended, false otherwise (if there was no such button-group).
